pysaleryd.skeleton module¶

This is a skeleton file that can serve as a starting point for a Python console script. To run this script uncomment the following lines in the [options.entry_points] section in setup.cfg:

console_scripts =
     pysaleryd = pysaleryd.skeleton:run

Then run pip install . (or pip install -e . for editable mode) which will install the command pysaleryd inside your current environment.

Besides console scripts, the header (i.e. until _logger…) of this file can also be used as template for Python modules.

Note

This file can be renamed depending on your needs or safely removed if not needed.

References

  • https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/userguide/entry_point.html

  • https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install

pysaleryd.skeleton.run()[source]¶

Calls main() passing the CLI arguments extracted from sys.argv

This function can be used as entry point to create console scripts with setuptools.

class pysaleryd.websocket.WSClient(session: ClientSession, host: str, port: int, callback: Callable[[Signal, str | None, State | None], Awaitable[None]])[source]¶

Bases: object

Websocket transport, session handling, message generation.

retry() → None[source]¶

Retry to connect to websocket.

Do an immediate retry without timer and without signalling state change. Signal state change only after first retry fails.

async running() → None[source]¶
